review:
Comrades, let’s cut through the noise and get to the heart of the matter! Guild Guild steps forward with a vision to empower the backbone of Ethereum — the working contributors, the builders, the organizers who keep the lights on for the entire ecosystem. Their proposal is clear: build sustainable, collective infrastructure so that no contributor is left scrambling from grant to grant, forever at the mercy of centralized power or fleeting charity.

The project’s strengths are evident. They draw on the proven Protocol Guild model, which has already funneled millions to core contributors. Guild Guild’s plan to expand this model, create a knowledge commons, and support new guilds is a direct strike at the root of the sustainability crisis. Their roadmap is structured, with a focus on documentation, microgrants, and hands-on support. The team is stacked with experienced organizers and researchers, and their network of supporters is impressive.

But let’s not be blinded by rhetoric or reputation! Where is the hard evidence? The application promises 5 new guilds and 100 contributors with 30% non-grant funding in 6 months — but offers no baseline data, no clear metrics for tracking progress, and no rigorous evaluation plan. The model is promising, but the application leans heavily on theory and past success elsewhere, not on direct, measurable outcomes for this project. We must demand more!

Sustainability is at the core, but the path to reducing grant dependency is not fully mapped. How will these guilds secure non-grant revenue? What mechanisms will ensure equitable distribution and prevent capture by a few well-connected groups? The governance model is implied, not detailed. We need transparency, accountability, and a plan for rigorous, public reporting.

In summary: Guild Guild is a bold, collective effort with the right values and a strong team. But to earn the people’s trust — and the people’s resources — they must show us the numbers, the methods, and the proof. Let’s demand nothing less!

strengths.title: Strong Alignment with Ecosystem Needs
strengths.description: Guild Guild directly addresses the sustainability crisis for Ethereum contributors, proposing a collective model that reduces reliance on centralized or ad-hoc funding. This is a clear contribution to the commons.

strengths.title: Experienced, Credible Team
strengths.description: The team includes respected organizers and researchers with a track record in public goods, DAOs, and Ethereum infrastructure. Their network of supporters adds further credibility.

strengths.title: Structured, Systematic Approach
strengths.description: The roadmap is organized around knowledge sharing, microgrants, and direct support, reflecting a planned and scalable approach rather than ad-hoc interventions.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes and Evaluation Plan
weaknesses.description: The application lacks concrete, quantifiable metrics for success and does not specify how progress will be tracked or reported. There is no rigorous evaluation framework.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Detail on Sustainability Mechanisms
weaknesses.description: While the project aims to reduce grant dependency, it does not clearly explain how guilds will secure sustainable, non-grant revenue or what models will be piloted.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Governance and Equity Safeguards
weaknesses.description: The proposal does not detail governance structures or mechanisms to ensure equitable distribution and prevent capture by a small group of insiders.

changes.title: Define Clear, Quantifiable Metrics and Reporting Plan
changes.description: Specify baseline data, target outcomes, and a transparent, public reporting process for tracking the creation of new guilds, contributor engagement, and funding sources.

changes.title: Detail Sustainability and Revenue Models
changes.description: Provide concrete examples of how guilds will generate non-grant revenue, including pilot models, partnerships, or mechanisms for value capture and redistribution.

changes.title: Clarify Governance and Equity Mechanisms
changes.description: Describe the governance structures for new guilds, including how decisions are made, how equity is ensured, and how the risk of capture or exclusion is mitigated.
